summary: This is a formal request letter from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the FBI's New York Field Office. The letter, dated August 20, 2019, seeks specific documents and records (including video footage, logs, and protocols) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to the time period surrounding Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019. It cites official statements and expresses concern over the circumstances and reported irregularities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

persons.name: William P. Barr

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney from Martin G. Weinberg, P.C., listed as co-counsel on the letter, also representing Epstein's estate in the evidence request.

connections.description: Miller, as part of Steptoe & Johnson, represents the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, acting as legal counsel in posthumous matters.
Weinberg is listed as co-counsel on the legal request, also representing Epstein's estate.
Both attorneys are jointly representing Epstein's estate in the formal request for evidence from the FBI/DOJ.
As Attorney General, Barr made public statements calling for an investigation into the circumstances and irregularities surrounding Epstein's death in federal custody.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. Life-saving measures were attempted, and he was transported to a hospital where he was pronounced dead. The FBI is investigating the incident.

events.title: Attorney General Barr's Statement on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William Barr stated publicly that 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility had been learned, which were 'deeply concerning' and demanded a thorough investigation.

events.title: Legal Request for Evidence
events.description: Attorneys for Epstein's estate formally requested specific documents and records from the DOJ/FBI related to the MCC for the period surrounding Epstein's death, citing concerns over the circumstances.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on the morning of August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide.
Attorney General William Barr publicly acknowledged 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility that demanded investigation following Epstein's death.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially delayed releasing a cause/manner of death determination, citing a need for 'further information' before announcing a conclusion.

Attorneys for Epstein's estate are formally seeking specific evidence from the DOJ, including MCC video recordings, entry/exit logs, guard logs, and death investigation protocols for the period of August 9-10, 2019.
The letter indicates the estate intends to conduct its own independent investigation into the circumstances of Epstein's death.
